about.summary: Vectorised distribution objects with tools for manipulating, visualising, and using probability distributions. Designed to allow model prediction outputs to return distributions rather than their parameters, allowing users to directly interact with predictive distributions in a data-oriented workflow. In addition to providing generic replacements for p/d/q/r functions, other useful statistics can be computed including means, variances, intervals, and highest density regions.

name: r-distributional
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-distributional
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/distributional_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/distributional/distributional_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: df6578a957e84cc16bef428fa61636c815ef23ea28680ff1cb6003c40364308b

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  skip: true  # [r_base == "3.5.1"]
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-digest
    - r-ellipsis
    - r-farver
    - r-generics
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-numderiv
    - r-rlang >=0.4.5
    - r-scales
    - r-vctrs >=0.3.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-digest
    - r-ellipsis
    - r-farver
    - r-generics
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-lifecycle
    - r-numderiv
    - r-rlang >=0.4.5
    - r-scales
    - r-vctrs >=0.3.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('distributional')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('distributional')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://pkg.mitchelloharawild.com/distributional/, https://github.com/mitchelloharawild/distributional
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Vectorised distribution objects with tools for manipulating, visualising, and using
    probability distributions. Designed to allow model prediction outputs to return
    distributions rather than their parameters, allowing users to directly interact
    with predictive distributions in a data-oriented workflow. In addition to providing
    generic replacements for p/d/q/r functions, other useful statistics can be computed
    including means, variances, intervals, and highest density regions.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: distributional
# Title: Vectorised Probability Distributions
# Version: 0.1.0
# Authors@R: c(person(given = "Mitchell", family = "O'Hara-Wild", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "mail@mitchelloharawild.com", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0001-6729-7695")), person(given = "Earo", family = "Wang", role = c("ctb"), comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0001-6448-5260")))
# Description: Vectorised distribution objects with tools for manipulating, visualising, and using probability distributions. Designed to allow model prediction outputs to return distributions rather than their parameters, allowing users to directly interact with predictive distributions in a data-oriented workflow. In addition to providing generic replacements for p/d/q/r functions, other useful statistics can be computed including means, variances, intervals, and highest density regions.
# License: GPL-3
# Imports: vctrs (>= 0.3.0), rlang (>= 0.4.5), generics, ellipsis, stats, numDeriv, ggplot2, scales, farver, digest, utils, lifecycle
# Suggests: testthat (>= 2.1.0), covr, mvtnorm, actuar
# RdMacros: lifecycle
# URL: https://pkg.mitchelloharawild.com/distributional/, https://github.com/mitchelloharawild/distributional
# BugReports: https://github.com/mitchelloharawild/distributional/issues
# Encoding: UTF-8
# Language: en-GB
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.0
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2020-06-03 23:13:11 UTC; mitchell
# Author: Mitchell O'Hara-Wild [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6729-7695>), Earo Wang [ctb] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0001-6448-5260>)
# Maintainer: Mitchell O'Hara-Wild <mail@mitchelloharawild.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-06-09 12:40:06 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.3
